New Website.title: New Website
New Website.description: Welcome to our new more searchable database of KSRE/KDA’s Foods Sold Direct to Consumers in Kansas: Regulations and Food Safety Best Practices (http://www.bookstore.ksre.ksu.edu/pubs/MF3138.pdf).  We updated the printed publication in Jan 2021, and those updates are also reflected in this database.

COVID-related guidance.title: COVID-related guidance
COVID-related guidance.preview: KDA provided updated COVID-related guidance to farmers markets
COVID-related guidance.description: KDA provided updated COVID-related guidance to farmers markets on February 10, 2021, which is available from the top of this page: https://fromthelandofkansas.com/page/farmers-market-resources

Upcoming food safety-related trainings.title: Upcoming food safety-related trainings
Upcoming food safety-related trainings.preview: KSRE has their upcoming food safety-related trainings available
Upcoming food safety-related trainings.description: KSRE has their upcoming food safety-related trainings available from: https://www.ksre.k-state.edu/foodsafety/

KSRE has produce safety resources.title: KSRE has produce safety resources
KSRE has produce safety resources.preview: KSRE has produce safety resources, as well as upcoming trainings, available
KSRE has produce safety resources.description: KSRE has produce safety resources, as well as upcoming trainings, available on our website: https://www.ksre.k-state.edu/foodsafety/produce/index.html

children.JamsJelliesShelfStableFood: Jams, Jellies, and Shelf Stable Food
children.MeatsEggsDairyProductsSeafood: Meats, Eggs, Dairy Products, and Seafood

JamsJelliesShelfStableFood.name: Jams, Jellies, and Shelf Stable Food

MeatsEggsDairyProductsSeafood.name: Meats, Eggs, Dairy Products, and Seafood

children.nonspecializedProcessedFoods: Non-specialized processed food that is made and sold six or fewer days in a year.

children.foodsAndBeveragesPreparedOffSite: Foods and beverages prepared off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or fewer times per calendar year.)
children.foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo: Foods and beverages prepared on or off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or more times per calendar year.)
Foods and beverages sold ready for immediate consumption by community groups for fundraising purposes
children.vacuumPackedFoods: Vacuum packaged foods requiring temperature control for safety

children.freshUncutFruitsVegetablesOrHerbs: Fresh (or dried) uncut fruits,  vegetables, or herbs (not cut beyond normal harvesting)
children.certainCutProduceAndCutHerbs: Certain cut produce and cut herbs (other than cut tomatoes, melons, or leafy greens)
children.intactSaladGreens: Intact salad greens (not cut beyond normal harvesting)

children.foodsAndBeveragesPreparedOffSite: Foods and beverages prepared off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or fewer times per calendar year.)
children.ProductsSafetyDippedInOrDecoratedWithCom: Products not requiring refrigeration for safety dipped in or decorated with commercially prepared melting chocolate
children.SCOBY: Symbiotic culture of bacteria and yeast (SCOBY)

children.homeCannedFruitAndJellies: Home canned fruit jams and jellies; jams and jellies flavored with pepper flavored vinegar or small amounts of pepper powder
children.pepperJamesAndJellies: Pepper jams and jellies (canned, shelf stable, other than those described above as exempt). includes jellies made with pepper juice.
children.lowSugarFruitJamsAndJellies: Low sugar fruit jams and jellies

children.fishAndSeafoodSoldWholeOnIce: Fish and seafood, sold whole on ice (does NOT include catfish and other Siluriformes)
children.fishAndSeafoodCleaned: Fish and seafood, cleaned (other than catfish)
children.rawCatfish: Meat, poultry (>20,000 birds/year), and catfish (rawNote: products containing 2% or more cooked meat or poultry or more than 3% raw meat by weight are considered meat products.)

children.cannedShelfStableNaturallyHighAcidFoods: Canned, shelf stable naturally high acid foods (and formulated acid foods)
children.acidifiedShelfStableCannedFoods: Acidified shelf stable canned foods/Low acid shelf stable canned foods
children.herbInfusedSimpleSyrups: Herb infused simple syrups, elderberry and other fruit syrups
children.homeCannedPicklesMeatsAndVegetables: Home canned pickles, meats, and vegetables

children.breadWithCheeseBakedInOrOnTop: Bread with cheese baked in/on top
children.bakedProductsWithPotentialHazards: Baked products with potentially hazardous dairy and egg products

icing.name: Icing with >65% sugar
icing.regulation: If the icing is known to contain >65% sugar, testing and licensing is not needed. Otherwise, testing and possibly licensing is required (see testing table).

freshUncutFruitsVegetablesOrHerbs.name: Fresh (or dried) uncut fruits,  vegetables, or herbs (not cut beyond normal harvesting)
freshUncutFruitsVegetablesOrHerbs.examples: Tomatoes, melons, okra, apples, basil, garlic scapes
freshUncutFruitsVegetablesOrHerbs.regulation: May be home grown; any pesticide use must comply with label directions.

intactSaladGreens.name: Intact salad greens (not cut beyond normal harvesting)
intactSaladGreens.examples: Mixed greens with only intact leaves, includes microgreens and shoots (not cut beyond normal harvesting practices)
intactSaladGreens.regulation: Follow weights and measures requirements. Note that all sprouts and any greens cut beyond normal harvesting require a license.

certainCutProduceAndCutHerbs.name: Certain cut produce and cut herbs (other than cut tomatoes, melons, or leafy greens)
certainCutProduceAndCutHerbs.examples: Cut berries, cut herbs, cut carrots, zucchini noodles, etc. Can be frozen, fresh, or dried.
certainCutProduceAndCutHerbs.regulation: If product is blanched before freezing and has a pH above 4.2, licensing is required for frozen foods. If not blanched first, no licensing required.

nutsAndNutButters.name: Nuts and nut butters
nutsAndNutButters.regulation: May be sold shelled or in shell. Peanut and other nut butters can also be sold direct to consumer without licensing.

honey.name: Honey
honey.regulation: Can sell direct to consumer without licensing. Note that sales of packaged honey to grocery stores (including consignment sales) for resale or sales by an individual that did not package the honey requires a KDA Food Processors License.

poultry.name: Poultry < 20,000 birds/year)
poultry.regulation: Growers raising fewer than 1,000 birds/year can slaughter and sell direct to consumer their own birds at their own facility without registration or inspection. Growers selling 1,001 to 20,000 birds/year must obtain a KDA Meat & Poultry Wholesaler license with a poultry exemption. The cost of a license is $25 per calendar year. More details available in

eggs.name: Eggs (< 250 hens)
eggs.regulation: Should be sold at <45F. Cartons should be clean and labeled properly. (Temperature control and labeling strongly suggested for establishments with fewer than 50 hens; temperature control and labeling required for farms with 51 to 249 hens, must be ungraded. Licensing (and grading) required with > 249 hens or if selling graded eggs.)

homeCannedFruitAndJellies.name: Home canned fruit jams and jellies; jams and jellies flavored with pepper flavored vinegar or small amounts of pepper powder
homeCannedFruitAndJellies.examples: Fruit jams and jellies (note that reduced or no-sugar jams or jellies require a product assessment)

juiceCider.name: Juice and cider
juiceCider.examples: Apple juice, apple cider, vegetable juices
juiceCider.regulation: No license required if sold packaged (served by the glass requires license.) If not pasteurized, must include a warning statement on the label (see p. 58, Kansas Food Code. Can be put into bottles or jugs, but not sealed or heat filled to be exempt.

cannedShelfStableNaturallyHighAcidFoods.name: Canned, shelf stable naturally high acid foods
cannedShelfStableNaturallyHighAcidFoods.regulation: Must follow labeling requirements. Requirements for other canned foods listed below.

candies.name: Candies (made in home kitchen)
candies.regulation: Note: homemade chocolates must be tested to determine if license is needed (see testing table on page 5).

fishAndSeafoodSoldWholeOnIce.name: Fish and seafood, sold whole on ice (does NOT include catfish and other Siluriformes)
fishAndSeafoodSoldWholeOnIce.regulation: No HACCP plan or processing license required. Note that wild caught fish sales are illegal without a commercial fishing permit from Kansas Department of Wildlife, Parks and Tourism. See K.S.A. 115 17 10 and 115 17 13 for more information.

cultivatedMushrooms.name: Cultivated mushrooms (culinary and medicinal)
cultivatedMushrooms.regulation: Note the regulations listed below for wild mushrooms.

foodsAndBeveragesPreparedOffSite.name: Foods and beverages prepared off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or fewer times per calendar year.)
foodsAndBeveragesPreparedOffSite.examples: Sandwiches, pizza, potato salad, etc. prepared and sold by any entity intended to be eaten at the market — six or fewer times per calendar ye
foodsAndBeveragesPreparedOffSite.regulation: No licensing required; however, must follow “Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments”. No licensing required; however, must follow Kansas Administrative Regulations (KAR) 4-28-33 “Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments”. More details also in KAR 4-28-34 (Exemption from licensure; definitions). Note that this would also include cooking classes and competitions, such as BBQ competitions.

foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo.name: Foods and beverages sold ready for immediate consumption by community groups for fundraising purposes
foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo.examples: Sandwiches, pizza, etc. prepared and sold by 4-H groups, church groups, schools, etc. (with no staff paid by the proceeds of the food sales).
foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo.regulation: No licensing required; however, must follow (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments). Fundraising for community or humanitarian purposes and educational or youth activities is exempt from licensing with no restriction on number of times done per year.

foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo.name: Foods and beverages prepared on or off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or more times per calendar year)
foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo.examples: Burritos, egg rolls, pizza, grilled hamburgers or other meats; lemonade
foodsAndBeveragesSoldReadyForImmediateCo.regulation: If selling more than six times/year, vendor must have a KDA Food Establishment license. Note that a Food Processing License would be required for any WHOLESALE sales.

nonspecializedProcessedFoods.name: Non specialized processed food that is made and sold six or fewer days in a year.
nonspecializedProcessedFoods.examples: Frozen bierocks, pork rinds, refrigerated noodles, pesto, refrigerator pickles, refrigerated salsa, etc.
nonspecializedProcessedFoods.license: The food product can be made on day one and each day they are sold adds to the total of up to 6 days without a license.
nonspecializedProcessedFoods.regulation: The food product can be made on day one and each day they are sold adds to the total of up to 6 days without a license. Must follow (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments) indicated above. Products such as pesto need to be cooled quickly and held at < 41F for no more than 6 days after preparing. Note that any products that require specialized processing* require advance approval even if it is for 6 or fewer days.

homemadeDriedPasta.name: Dried egg noodles
homemadeDriedPasta.regulation: No licensing required if dried in a protected environment in a short time period

vanillaExtract.name: Vanilla extract
vanillaExtract.regulation: No licensing needed if the product meets the standard of identity in 21 CFR 169.175 to ensure it is vanilla extract and not a flavored alcohol.

spices.name: Spices
spices.regulation: Product must be labeled properly, unadulterated, and sold in a sanitary manner

lard.name: Lard
lard.regulation: No licensing required if sold direct to consumer.

pepperVinegars.name: Pepper vinegars
pepperVinegars.regulation: RAW peppers must be used in making pepper vinegar to sell without a license

herbFlavoredInfusedVinegars.name: Herb flavored/infused vinegars
herbFlavoredInfusedVinegars.examples: Fresh tarragon, fresh garlic, fresh basil poured over with vinegar
herbFlavoredInfusedVinegars.regulation: Unless using low acid vinegar (pH>4.2) or enough herbs included to raise equilibrium pH above 4.2, product does NOT require a license.

grainProducts.name: Grain products
grainProducts.examples: Home-ground flour, cornmeal, popcorn, intact grain
grainProducts.regulation: Standard hygiene and sanitation requirements, as with all food sold

fruitLeathers.name: Fruit leathers
fruitLeathers.regulation: Standard hygiene and sanitation requirements, as with all food sold

SamplingOfFoodProducts.name: Sampling of food products
SamplingOfFoodProducts.regulation: Samples must be prepared and served in a sanitary manner. More details available in the KSRE/KDA publication MF3311 on Sampling Safely at Kansas Farmers Markets.)

dairyProducts.name: Dairy products milk
dairyProducts.examples: Milk, cheese, yogurt, etc. from cows, goats, other mammals
dairyProducts.license: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
dairyProducts.regulation: Pasteurized and processed at KDA licensed Dairy Manufacturing Plant; food establishment license required at point of sale. Note that if a vendor can provide information about a vacuum packaged cheese to show that it does not require refrigeration for safety (typically low water activity and low pH values), a food establishment license would NOT be required for the point of sale.

bakedProductsWithPotentialHazards.name: Baked products with potentially hazardous dairy and egg products
bakedProductsWithPotentialHazards.examples: Cheesecake, cream filled cupcakes or donuts, cream cheese-based frostings or fillings, cream or meringue pies, custards, pumpkin pie, quiche
bakedProductsWithPotentialHazards.regulation: Food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale.

dough.name: Dough
dough.examples: Refrigerated or frozen cookie dough, pizza dough
dough.regulation: Product requires temperature control for safety, so a food establishment license is required.

rawCatfish.name: Meat, poultry (>20,000 birds/year), and catfish (rawNote: products containing 2% or more cooked meat or poultry or more than 3% raw meat by weight are considered meat products.)
rawCatfish.examples: Steaks, ground beef, fresh sausages, turkey, chicken, catfish
rawCatfish.regulation: Product must be processed at a fully inspected facility, pre-packaged and properly labeled. A KDA Meat & Poultry Wholesale license must be obtained before any product is sold, regardless if the target audience is the end consumer or a wholesale account.  Product may be sold refrigerated or frozen solid.

readyToEatCatfish.name: Catfish ready to eat
readyToEatCatfish.examples: Jerky, summer sausage and similar products
readyToEatCatfish.regulation: Product must be inspected by KDA or USDA and sold at the appropriate temperature. Note that any curing of meat using nitrites requires proper licensing.

fishAndSeafoodCleaned.name: Fish and seafood, cleaned (other than catfish)
fishAndSeafoodCleaned.regulation: KDA food establishment or food processing license at preparation facility, Hazard Analysis, food establishment license at the point of sale. An HACCP plan is also needed if any hazards are identified as being reasonably likely to occur. Note that wild caught fish sales are illegal without a commercial fishing permit from KDWPT.

vacuumPackedFoods.name: Vacuum packaged foods requiring temperature control for safety
vacuumPackedFoods.examples: Vacuum-packaged cheese or vacuum-packaged meats requiring refrigeration for safety
vacuumPackedFoods.regulation: Must follow the above listed requirements of cheese or meat products or whatever category the food is in.

sprouts.name: Sprouts
sprouts.regulation: KDA food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale.

cutLeafyGreens.name: Cut leafy greens (fresh or dried)
cutLeafyGreens.examples: Cut or torn lettuce (cut beyond normal harvesting)
cutLeafyGreens.regulation: KDA food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale. Must be sold at or below 41F.

certainCutProduce.name: Certain cut produce (fresh or dried)
certainCutProduce.regulation: KDA food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale.

roastedVegetables.name: Roasted vegetables
roastedVegetables.regulation: Temperature control is required for safety; therefore, KDA license is required. Note that even if you are selling raw produce and providing roasting services on site, you would still need a license. Must wash before roasting.

wildMushrooms.name: Wild mushrooms
wildMushrooms.regulation: Mushrooms picked in the wild must be individually inspected for safety by a KDA registered mushroom identifier. More information available in the Selling Fresh Produce section.

naturallyFermentedCannedGoods.name: Naturally fermented canned foods
naturallyFermentedCannedGoods.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License required for production facility.

acidifiedShelfStableCannedFoods.name: Acidified shelf stable canned foods/Low acid shelf stable canned foods
acidifiedShelfStableCannedFoods.examples: Pickles (includes pickled vegetables and pickled eggs), hot sauces, canned tomatoes. Canned vegetables, meats, cake/bread baked in a jar
acidifiedShelfStableCannedFoods.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License or Food Processors License required for production facility. Requires recipe approval; Better Process Control School (BPCS) required. KDA Meat and Poultry inspection required if canned meat is sold wholesale. Contact Kansas State University Value Added Foods Lab for more information on recipe approval and BPCS

alcoholicBeverages.name: Alcoholic beverages (>0.5% alcohol by volume)
alcoholicBeverages.regulation: Kansas Dept. of Revenue alcohol licensing requirements.

infusedOils.name: Infused oils
infusedOils.examples: Infused cooking olive oils; garlic in oil mixtures
infusedOils.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License or Food Processors License required for production facility. If finished product is not shelf stable, food establishment license also required for point of sale.

animalFeedAndTreats.name: Animal feed/treats
animalFeedAndTreats.examples: Pet food/treats — regardless of the type of ingredients in the pet treats (meat or grain, etc.)
animalFeedAndTreats.regulation: Kansas commercial feed license and small pet product application required. Food safety license not required (may be made in a home kitchen). Guaranteed analysis for protein, fat, and fiber, and ingredient statement required on label. (More information available from: programs/dairy inspection/feed safety/feed licenses)

broths.name: Broths
broths.regulation: If includes less than 2% meat or poultry (after cooking), KDA Food Establishment licence required (for direct to consumer sales). KDA Food processing license required if selling wholesale. If canned and sold shelf stable, follow acidified or low acid canned food requirements (see above).

pepperJamesAndJellies.name: Pepper jams and jellies (canned, shelf stable, other than those described above as exempt). Includes jellies made with pepper juice.
pepperJamesAndJellies.license: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
pepperJamesAndJellies.regulation: If product is determined to have low water activity, product can be sold without a license. Otherwise, KDA license required. Read the Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales

lowSugarFruitJamsAndJellies.name: Low sugar fruit jams and jellies
lowSugarFruitJamsAndJellies.license: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
lowSugarFruitJamsAndJellies.regulation: If product is determined to be an acid food, formulated acid, or low water activity food, no license is required. Otherwise, KDA license required. Read the Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales

salsa.name: Salsa
salsa.regulation: Depending on the pH of the final product and the main product ingredients, the product may be exempt from licensing or may be considered an acidified canned food that requires a license (see information on acidified foods in table above).

chocolateCandies.name: Chocolate Candies and meringue cookies
chocolateCandies.regulation: If product is determined to require temperature control for safety in a product assessment, KDA license is required. Otherwise, no license is required.

pecanPie.name: Pecan Pie
pecanPie.temperatureControl:
Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above 
 https://agriculture.ks.gov/divisions-programs/food-safety-lodging/food-safety-licenses
pecanPie.regulation: If the filling is determined to require temperature control based on its water activity, KDA license is required. Otherwise, no license is required.

PowderedSugarAndMilkIcing.name: Powdered sugar/ milk icing
PowderedSugarAndMilkIcing.license: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
PowderedSugarAndMilkIcing.regulation: Often used on cinnamon rolls and similar products. If product is determined to have low water activity, product can be sold without a license. Otherwise, KDA license required. Read the Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales Note that if the icing is known to contain >65% sugar, testing and licensing is not needed.

breadWithCheeseBakedInOrOnTop.name: Bread with cheese baked in/on top
breadWithCheeseBakedInOrOnTop.license: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
breadWithCheeseBakedInOrOnTop.temperatureControl: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
breadWithCheeseBakedInOrOnTop.regulation: If product is determined to have low water activity and thus not require refrigeration for safety, product can be sold without a license. Otherwise, KDA license required. Read the Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales

homemadeMustard.name: Homemade mustard
homemadeMustard.temperatureControl: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
homemadeMustard.regulation: If the product is determined to have pH below 4.6 and that it can be safely stored at room temperature, product can be sold direct to consumer without a license. Otherwise, KDA license is required.

herbInfusedSimpleSyrups.name: Herb infused simple syrups, elderberry and other fruit syrups
herbInfusedSimpleSyrups.license: Read the 'Regulatory Requirements for Direct to Consumer Sales' information listed above
herbInfusedSimpleSyrups.regulation: If product is determined to be a low water activity food, no license is required. Otherwise, KDA license is required.

homeCannedPicklesMeatsAndVegetables.name: Home canned pickles, meats, and vegetables

UninspectedMeatOrPoultry.name: Uninspected meat or poultry
UninspectedMeatOrPoultry.regulation: Must be processed at an inspected facility; note the poultry exemption indicated in the table that begins on page 2.

ProductsSafetyDippedInOrDecoratedWithCom.name: Products not requiring refrigeration for safety dipped in or decorated with commercially prepared melting chocolate
ProductsSafetyDippedInOrDecoratedWithCom.regulation: Note: homemade chocolates must be tested to determine if license is needed (see testing table on page 5).

LooseLeafTeas.name: Loose leaf teas
LooseLeafTeas.regulation: Product must be labeled properly, unadulterated, and sold in a sanitary manner.

SproutedGrains.name: Sprouted grains (fresh or dried/dehydrated)
SproutedGrains.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License required for production facility.

SCOBY.name: Symbiotic culture of bacteria and yeast (SCOBY)
SCOBY.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License required for production facility.
